wikipedia_page.main:
Albert Gossage Robinson (born Wellingborough, 12 November 1863; died Salisbury - 13 September 1948) was an Anglican  priest, most notably Archdeacon of Surrey from 1908 to 1922.Robinson was educated at Lord Williams's School, Thame and Christ's College, Cambridge. He was ordained in 1889. 
 After curacies in Darlington, Rownhams and Meole Brace he held incumbencies at Toft, Busbridge and Ryde.

response: * Albert Robinson (Australian politician) (1877–1943), Australian Senator and member of the South Australian House of Assembly
* Albert Robinson (footballer, born 1948) (1948–1995), footballer for Chester City
* Albert Robinson (footballer, born 1913) (1913–?), English footballer for Mansfield Town
